description: {"blocks":[{"key":"6m0ah","text":"This protocol focuses on the preparation of human whole blood samples for analysis by flow cytometry. warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"fu2u","text":"If you work with untested human samples (e.g. status of Hepatitis B/C and HIV is unknown), all experiments must be carried out in a Class II biosafety cabinet (with laminar air flow). Liquid waste has to be collected and autoclaved before disposal, contaminated materials have to be collected and disposed of separately from other lab waste as they are potentially infectious.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":17,"length":23},{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":1},{"style":"bold","offset":132,"length":50},{"style":"bold","offset":221,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":296,"length":23}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5ivoe","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9a2vq","text":"Use caps/lids to close your FACS tube when removing them from the biosafety cabinet for centrifugation.
